info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 22 at 4:07PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Graham and southwestern Greenlee Counties through 500 PM MST... At 406 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Roper Lake State Park, or 7 miles south of Safford, moving north at 10 to 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Safford, Thatcher, Solomon, Roper Lake State Park, Safford Regional Airport, Pima, Central, Swift Trail Junction, Mount Graham and Frye Mesa Dam. This includes the following highways... Route 70 between mile markers 327 and 354. Route 191 between mile markers 108 and 137. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
